_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Scott's Liquid Gold--Inc., (SLG) is a public corporation manufacturing and marketing, nationally and internation-
ally, houehold chemical products in liquid and aerosol forms, namely, Scott's Liquid Gold Wood Cleaner and
Preservative and a single phase air Freshener, Touch of Scent.  92 employees work at SLG's corporate
headquarters and manufacturing facility located at 4880 Havana Street, Denver, CO.  The SLG process which 
is subject to 40 CFR Par 58 is the receiving, storage, transfer, and pressurization of a 2Qaerosol container,
utilizing an aerosol grade propellant (100% 1,1 Difluoroethane), trade name 152A.  Written operating proced-
ures requiring daily personal and mechanical monitoring are closely followed to prevent no more than 13,000 
gallons of 152A from being present in an 18000 gallon capacity, non-pressurized outside above-ground storage
tank.  The tank is located in a fenced, secured area, an estimated 80' from the north wall of the facility and is
video monitored 24 hours/day, 7 days/week.  It is also physically inspected on a daily basis by maintenance
and security professionals and weekly by production and regulatory/safety professionals.  Any deficiencies 
are documented and followed up with immediate remedial action.  Strict Good Manufacturing Processes and 
state of the art active/passive detection, prevention and fire/explosion repression systems are utilized to
minimize the possibility of any loss scenarios.  SLG is in complete compliance with local, state and federal 
regulations.  It is the philosophy of SLG to go beyond minimum requirements to approach compliance in a 
comprehensive, multifaceted approach to aid in the prevention, detection and control of loss potentials.  SLG
was recently awarded Merit Status under VPP and will be scheduling their Star Audit in June 2005.  Although
SLG has not experienced any loss incidents since beginning to utilize 152A in 2004 and its predecessor 
152a/A-17.8218 in 1996, response will be immediate wit

h appropriate preventative and prtection measures,
after observing or otherwise learning of the most remote possibility of loss potential.
